column4: I still have no luck getin flash to work on Ubuntu. It's not working on firefox,chrome and chromium.
What have you done so far?
I installed one from the official adobe website via USC,then i installed via terminal sudo apt-get install flashplugin-installer.
Is there any other way,i am thinking about trying with Synaptic. I think there was someting like flashplugin-nonfree. But i can't remember.
adobe-flashplugin is already the newest version.
Could not load shockwave flash. Same thing.
Yeah,i hate thing. I usually install everything i need via terminal.
Synaptic is very good. Never had a single problem with it.
The problem is, there's so many "flash" packages...
Why are you using an outdated version anyway?
Flash does have problems on 10.10 if that's what you're using.
